newsitem.title: CHINA: China gold mine looking for foreign investment.
newsitem.headline: China gold mine looking for foreign investment.

text.p: Southwestern China's Guizhou province is looking for foreign funds to help to develop its Lannigou Gold Mine, the Xinhua news agency said on Thursday.
The mine in the Miao-Bouyei prefecture was near the Nanning-Kunming railway that is scheduled to open in July as well as a 2,520 megawatt power plant being built in the area, Xinhua said.
Lannigou has proven reserves of 60 tonnes, earlier reports have said.

At least three foreign firms have shown an interest in developing Lannigou -- Newmont Gold of the U.S., Australia's Broken Hill Proprietary Ltd and the Gencor Group of South Africa, officials have said. They said last month that a decision on foreign cooperation could come within five months.
Newmont first showed interest in the site in 1993.
Four large gold deposits had been found in the prefecture, which produced 2.0 tonnes of gold in 1996, Xinhua said but gave no further details.
